description_txt: stated on December 7, 2014 in comments on ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: Says President Barack Obama "has lost more members of the House and more members of the Senate than any president ever has lost" in modern times.

description_txt: stated on November 18, 2014 in a community forum:
quote_txt: "There are more African American men in prison, jail, on probation or parole than were enslaved in 1850."

description_txt: stated on November 18, 2014 in newspaper article:
quote_txt: Thirty-eight states -- Georgia not included -- have appointed, rather than elected, state school superintendents.

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: At the 50 Milwaukee schools serving "at least 80% African-American and at least 80% low income" students, the reading proficiency is 8%.

description_txt: stated on November 11, 2014 in a radio interview:
quote_txt: "We've had the lowest health care inflation in history because of Obamacare."

description_txt: stated on December 5, 2014 in a meme on social media:
quote_txt: "In 1990, the U.S. led the world in the percentage of 25-34 year olds with college degrees. Today we are in 12th place."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2014 in a committee hearing:
quote_txt: President Barack Obama "said over 20 times he did not have the legal authority" to act as he did on immigration.

description_txt: stated on July 21, 2014 in an episode of HBO's Real Sports with Bryant Gumbel:
quote_txt: "A golf course closes somewhere in America every 48 hours."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2014 in a chain email:
quote_txt: Says a man in Ferguson, Mo., was photographed holding a sign that said, "No mother should have to fear for her son's life every time he robs a store."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2014 in a speech:
quote_txt: Says Barack Obama has "the worst record of any president when it comes to putting America deeper in debt."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2014 in a segment on "The O'Reilly Factor":
quote_txt: "In 2012, 123 African-Americans were shot dead by police. ... Same year, 326 whites were killed by police."

description_txt: stated on November 25, 2014 in remarks at the National Press Club:
quote_txt: In 2010, uninsured voters made up "about 5 percent of the electorate."

description_txt: stated on December 1, 2014 in a 'Wall Street Journal' CEO Council event:
quote_txt: "Too many" tattoos "on visible body parts" keep some applicants out of the military.

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2014 in an appearance on 'Fox News Sunday':
quote_txt: "The number of killings of citizens by police is at a two-decade high."

description_txt: stated on November 30, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: "We’re borrowing 20% of (the federal) budget."

description_txt: stated on November 28, 2014 in an Atlanta Journal-Constitution story:
quote_txt: Atlanta Mayor Kasim Reed became a city resident in the last annexation, opening the door to his candidacy.

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2014 in a meme on social media:
quote_txt: "794 law enforcement officers have fallen in the line of duty since B.H. Obama took office, with no special recognition from the White House."

description_txt: stated on December 7, 2014 in an op-ed in the "Statesman Journal":
quote_txt: Immigrants "have captured all of the nearly 9 million jobs created since 2000."

description_txt: stated on December 2, 2014 in a meme:
quote_txt: "The U.S. Constitution owes its notion of democracy to the Iroquois Tribes."

description_txt: stated on November 19, 2014 in an announcement.:
quote_txt: The poorest counties in the U.S. are in Appalachia and "happen to be more than 90 percent white."

description_txt: stated on November 5, 2014 in an opinion piece:
quote_txt: "Wisconsin’s state budget is almost twice as large per person as the state budget of Texas, and even after billions in tax cuts, Wisconsin’s working families and businesses remain subject to a heavy tax burden."

description_txt: stated on November 20, 2014 in a news release.:
quote_txt: "Every president since Eisenhower has taken executive action to address immigration issues."

description_txt: stated on November 14, 2014 in a newspaper interview:
quote_txt: Rhode Island's legislature is "the strongest in the country."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2014 in an interview:
quote_txt: Wisconsin is below the national average in wage growth and job growth.

description_txt: stated on November 5, 2014 in as quoted in a news story:
quote_txt: Austin is "burdened by the fastest-growing tax increases of any major city in the nation."

description_txt: stated on November 9, 2014 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: "Our median income here in Providence is the same as the median income in Mississippi."

description_txt: stated on November 24, 2014 in an interview on 'Fox and Friends':
quote_txt: "The conviction rate is almost exactly the same" for whites and blacks who commit murder.

description_txt: stated on November 23, 2014 in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press":
quote_txt: Says "93 percent of blacks in America are killed by other blacks."

description_txt: stated on November 20, 2014 in a speech:
quote_txt: Citing his efforts to secure the border, Obama said, "Overall, the number of people trying to cross our border illegally is the lowest it has been since the 1970s."

description_txt: stated on November 17, 2014 in a commentary:
quote_txt: "Texas had the worst voter participation in the country" in the November 2014 elections.
